question.title: How to take selected option and pass it to the controller in Java with Thymeleaf?
question.body:
I have values which are shown in the dropdown from the database, but I want to take the selected value from the dropdown and open url with a parameter of this value.

For example http://localhost:8080/showMap?region={region}

<form th:action="@{/showMap}" th:method="POST" th:object="${regions}">
  <label for="region" style="border: 1px solid orange;">Region:</label>
  <br />
  <select id="region" class="form-control" th:href="@{/showMap/{region}(region=${r})}">
    <option value="">- Choose region -</option>
    <option th:each="r : ${regions}" th:text="${r}" th:value="${r}"></option>
  </select>
</form>

answers.body:
One possible way to do this is:

  • Change the form method to GET
  • Add a name attribute to the select
  • Add a button to trigger the form
  • Remove the href from the select (not valid HTML)

The result of this would be the browser goes to /showMap?region={region}. Your th:href on the select (which should be removed) is creating a URL as /showMap/{region}.

The difference is a query param vs a path param. Apart from that, it should work.

<form th:action="@{/showMap}" th:method="GET" th:object="${regions}">
  <label for="region" style="border: 1px solid orange;">Region:</label>
  <br />
  <select id="region" name="region" class="form-control">
    <option value="">- Choose region -</option>
    <option th:each="r : ${regions}" th:text="${r}" th:value="${r}"></option>
  </select>
  <button>Go!</button>
</form>

question_comments.body: 1) The form is defined as being a HTTP-POST, so any selection will be submitted as part of the POST body, rather than a query parameter. 2) <select> doesn't take href="...", so th:href="@{/showMap/{region}(region=${r})}" is unlikely to yield anything usefull (perhaps you meant <option selected=""> instead)
